content.xhtml:p:
DAQ_AI_I call("megaind-rpi.getInputCurrent", {"DAQ_AI_I_STACK_PSM": [0..7], "DAQ_AI_I_CHANNEL_PSM": [1..4]}) We can experience 32 indexes 0..7 stack times 1..4 inputs.
▐ The sequence of variables from DAQ are: ▐ ▐ 1 = PIT129 ▌ 2 = PIT118 ▐ 3 = LIT125 ▌ 4 = FIT116▐
DAQ_AI_U call("megaind-rpi.getInputVoltage", {"DAQ_AI_U_STACK_PSM": [0..7], "DAQ_AI_U_CHANNEL_PSM": [1..4]}) We can experience 32 indexes 0..7 stack times 1..4 output.
DAQ_DI_OPTO call("megaind-rpi.getInputOpto", {"DAQ_DI_OPTO_PSM": [0..7], "DAQ_DI_OPTO_CHANNEL_PSM": [1..4]}) We can experience 32 indexes 0..7 stack times 1..4 output.
DAQ_AO_I_RD call("megaind-rpi.GetOutputCurrent", {"DAQ_AO_I_WT_STACK_PSM": [0..7], "DAQ_AO_I_WT_CHANNEL_PSM":[1..4]}) We can experience 32 indexes 0..7 stack times 1..4 inputs.
DAQ_AO_U_RD call("megaind-rpi.getOutputVoltage", {"DAQ_AO_U_RD_STACK_PSM": [0..7], "DAQ_AO_U_RD_CHANNEL_PSM": [1..4]}) We can experience 32 indexes 0..7 stack times 1..4 output.
DAQ_AO_U_RD1 call("megaind-rpi.getOutputVoltage", {"DAQ_AO_OD_RD_STACK_PSM": [0..7], "DAQ_AO_OD_RD_CHANNEL_PSM": [1..4]}) We can experience 32 indexes 0..7 stack times 1..4 output.

DAQ_AO_U_WT call("megaind-rpi.setOutputVoltage", {"DAQ_AO_U_WT_STACK_PSM": [0..7], "DAQ_AO_U_WT_CHANNEL_PSM":[1..4]}, "DAQ_AO_U_WT_VALUE_PSM": [0..100]} ) We can experience 32 indexes 0..7 stack times 1..4 inputs.

DAQ_AO_I_WT call("megaind-rpi.setOutputCurrent", {"DAQ_AO_I_WT_STACK_PSM": [0..7], "DAQ_AO_I_WT_CHANNEL_PSM":[1..4]}, "DAQ_AO_I_WT_VALUE_PSM": [0..100]} ) We can experience 32 indexes 0..7 stack times 1..4 inputs.

DAQ_AO_OD_WT call("megaind-rpi.setOutputVoltage", {"DAQ_AO_OD_WT_STACK_PSM": [0..7], "DAQ_AO_OD_WT_CHANNEL_PSM":[1..4]}, "DAQ_AO_OD_WT_VALUE_PSM": [0..100]}) We can experience 32 indexes 0..7 stack times 1..4 inputs.

documentation.xhtml:p: PID4 - Unique Integer Number to define the control loop (%QW23)
PID4 - (PID4 - 10) I=xx; Ti=P/I [To reduce its installment, make Ti higher than 1.0] (%QW25)
PID4 - (x10) D=xx; Td=D/P [To reduce its installment, make Ti smaller than 1.0] (%QW26)
PID Unique Integer Number to define the control loop
PID4 - Unique Integer Number to define the control loop (%QW41)
PID4 - (PID4 - 10) I=xx; Ti=P/I [To reduce its installment, make Ti higher than 1.0] (%QW25)
PID4 - (x10) D=xx; Td=D/P [To reduce its installment, make Ti smaller than 1.0] (%QW26)
